initialize

public void initialize(int[] indices,
                       org.supremica.automata.algorithms.AutomataSynchronizerHelper helper)

initCosts

public void initCosts()
This method should only be called if the current state is initial in the composed automaton. The currentCosts are then set to composedCosts.

Overrides:
initCosts in class State

getCompositeCosts

public double[] getCompositeCosts()
Returns the costs corresponding to the underlying states. Overrides the @link getCost() method in org.supremica.automata.State.java.

getCurrentCosts

public double[] getCurrentCosts()
Returns the current costs associated to this state (keeping in mind the path to this state).

updateCosts

public void updateCosts(double[] prevCurrentCosts,
                        boolean[] firingAutomata,
                        double prevAccumulatedCost)
Calculates and updates the currentCosts-vector and the accumulated cost. The costs in the previously visited state must be submitted as parameters. If the current state does not have any underlying cost(s) associated, the accumulatedCost of the previously visited state is kept.

updateCosts

public void updateCosts(State state)
Calculates the firing automata and other necessary parameters and calls updateCosts(int[], boolean[], int);

Overrides:
updateCosts in class State

getFiringAutomata

public boolean[] getFiringAutomata(CompositeState prevState)
Calculates the automaton/a that fired the transition from to this state.

Parameters:
prevState - CompositeState prevState - previously visited state

public java.util.ArrayList getComposingStates()
